results.title: Phiguring out acids and bases
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Shane Mulcahy
results.brief_description: Examines the acids and bases in everyday use and develops the idea of ph measurment both quantitatively and qualitatively as a measure of concentration.This program presents historical developments of the proton/theory and pH notation. Practical applications of pH testing and adjustments are also covered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Shane Mulcahy

results.title: Phenomena
results.brief_description: Creepy thriller from horror maestro Dario Argento features a strong performance from a very young Jennifer Connelly as an imperilled schoolgirl (also named Jennifer) who undergoes a series of frightening encounters whilst boarding at a Swiss finishing school. After experiencing nightmares that provide insight into a serial killer’s movements, Jennifer’s talent for communicating with insects links her to bug specialist Dr McGregor, with whom she aims to unmask the murderer. Engaging in the tropes of the genre - and using his trademark gore and gross-out aesthetics - Argento provides an array of thrills, scares and narrative twists all backed by a rock soundtrack. Uncut, uncensored widescreen edition. Also known as “Creepers” (US title).

results.title: Phasing in metric designs
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, New Decade Productions, Stanley Marks and Stephen Cross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The changeover to metric design will normally be gradual and needs careful preparation. Imperial past can be incorporated in a metric environment of vice versa.

results.title: Phase one: Prince Charles Mountains
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Roger Hayne
results.brief_description: Shows the work of a topographical and geological survey of the Prince Charles Mountains, Antarctica in 1969. Under summer conditions the land forms are visible, and valuable data is collected and evaluated.

results.title: Phase diagrams
results.brief_description: The construction and use of phase diagrams and why they are a critical part of understanding how igneous rocks form. Deals with the construction and use of phase diagrams. Demonstrates how a simple diagram can be built and extended to three component systems. Step by step a three-dimensional phase diagram using three binary eutectics is constructed. Shows how phase diagrams can contribute to our understanding of how igneous rocks form, and demonstrates both basalt and granite systems.

results.title: Pharmacy
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing the pharmacist at work in the preparation of preventative and curative medicines. Discusses careers in the corner pharmacy, in a large pharmaceutical company or in a hospital.

results.title: Pharmaceuticals
results.creator_credit: WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen and Robert Richter
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of the danger to humans or the environment are exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in toxic pharmaceuticals.

results.title: Pharaoh = Faraon [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: ZRF Kadr, WFF Lodz, Film Polski, Ludwik Hager and Jerzy Kawalerowicz
results.brief_description: An epic costume drama set in ancient Egyptian times during the reign of Pharaoh Ramses XIII (Jerzy Zelnik), who, in defiance of tradition, assumed command of the military - a post usually occupied by priests. The story tells of the battle which consequently ensued between Ramses and his followers and the power driven priests. Based on the novel by Boleslaw Prus and starring Wieslaw Mazurkiewicz, Barbara Brylska, Krystyna Mikolajewska, Ewa Krzyzanowska, Jerzy Buczacki, Leszek Herdegen. Photography by Jerzy Wojcik. (Awards: Nominated for Best Foreign Language Film in 1967 Oscars and Golden Palm in 1966 Cannes Film Festival) NOTE: Colour appears to be faded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ZRF Kadr, WFF Lodz, Film Polski, Ludwik Hager and Jerzy Kawalerowicz

results.title: Phar Lap: the people's champion [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hall of Fame Corporation, Rhett Kirkwood, Michael Dickinson and Eddie Carnana
results.brief_description: The People’s champion, Phar Lap, is an icon of Australia’s past. This video contains previously unseen footage of the greatest thoroughbred there ever was. Footage is contributed featuring Tommy Woodcock, Harry Telford and American businessman David Davis, as well as including the amazing story of Cups King Bart Cummings, whose record 10 Melbourne Cup triumphs is equally worthy of praise.
